meanings.definition: To lie or wait in concealment, as a person in ambush; remain in or around a place secretly or furtively.
meanings.sent1: The cat was lurking behind the bushes, waiting to pounce on the unsuspecting bird.
meanings.sent2: The detective was lurking in the shadows, keeping a close eye on the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was lurking near the cookie jar, hoping to snatch a treat.
meanings.sent4: Danger was always lurking in the dark alleyways of the city.
meanings.sent5: The sense of danger lurking in the forest made her heart race.

meanings.sent1: The thief was lurking around the corner, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
meanings.sent2: The fox was lurking near the henhouse, planning its next stealthy move.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was lurking around the campsite, looking for any scraps of food to snatch.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of guilt was always lurking in the back of his mind after he stole the candy.
meanings.sent5: The temptation to lurk in the shadows and steal was strong for the sneaky cat burglar.

meanings.sent1: Doubt was always lurking in the back of her mind, making her question everything.
meanings.sent2: The truth was lurking just beneath the surface, waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent3: The answer to the riddle was lurking in the old dusty book on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The potential for greatness was lurking within him, waiting to be unleashed.
meanings.sent5: The magic of the unknown was lurking in the air, creating an aura of mystery.
